title: Business & Finance
text:
Salesforce plans for most of its employees to work remotely part or full time after the pandemic and to reduce its real-estate footprint.

---

China's Huawei filed a lawsuit in the U.S. disputing its designation as a national security threat by the FCC.

---

SoftBank plans to invest $900 million in gene-sequencing firm PacBio.

---

Twitter added users through the holiday quarter and said it continued to add more in January, the month it banned Trump.

---

Vornado Realty is exploring ways to end a lucrative partnership with Trump's real-estate company.

---

The number of help-wanted ads returned to pre-pandemic levels in January, a sign that hiring could pick up.

---

Nasdaq, the NYSE and Cboe sued the SEC to block its plan to overhaul the public data feeds that broadcast stock prices to investors.

---

The S&P 500 fell 0.1% and the Dow slipped 0.03%, while the Nasdaq advanced 0.1% to another record.

---

CD Projekt, the game maker behind "Cyberpunk 2077," said its internal systems were hit by a cyberattack.

---

The PepsiCo unit that sells Aunt Jemima pancake products is rebranding them under the name Pearl Milling Co.
